selection_rules: Use when industry and audience are known

prompt_template: Pros and cons of leading {product_or_service} for {pain_point}
Difference between {product_or_service} and adjacent tools in {industry}
What do experts use for {pain_point} in {industry}?
Total cost of ownership for {product_or_service} over {timeframe}
Define {unique_feature} and why it matters for {target_audience}

selection_rules: Use for simple non-branded 'best X for Y' searches
notes: Baseline 'best X for Y' query for quick visibility checks

selection_rules: Use when local + audience context matters
notes: Geo + audience 'best' query to test local rankings

selection_rules: Use when user frames search around a problem and category
notes: Idea-style discovery that surfaces solution types and brands

selection_rules: Use when price sensitivity is explicit

notes: Combines geo and price to mimic real buyer searches

selection_rules: Use when buyer cares about a specific capability
notes: Shows which brands own a named feature in AI results

selection_rules: Use for natural language feature-led discovery
notes: Closer to 'looking for X with Y feature' type queries

selection_rules: Use when search is framed as 'solve this problem'
notes: Good for job-to-be-done style visibility checks

selection_rules: Use when buyer has not picked a solution type yet
notes: Surfaces both product categories and brands for a problem

selection_rules: Use for direct recommendation intent tests
notes: Mimics 'what should I use' style AI questions
